articles.title: How to keep data centers from breaking the grid
articles.author: Fast Company
articles.summary: AI's growth depends on a backbone of vast energy-hungry, water intensive data centers. The challenge is to ensure this infrastructure scales without hollowing out long-term value. Across the U.S., states are racing to build new data centers to meet the demand.

articles.title: A.I. Spending Is Accelerating Among Tech's Biggest Companies
articles.author: New York Times
articles.summary: Despite the risk of a bubble, Google, Meta, Microsoft and Amazon plan to spend billions more on artificial intelligence than they already do, despite the fact that it's not a good idea at this time. Google, Microsoft, Amazon and Meta will spend billions on AI.

articles.title: OpenAI explains how it plans to start making money from Sora users
articles.author: system
articles.summary: OpenAI monetizes its AI video generation app. Users can now pay $4 for 10 additional videos beyond the daily free limit. The head of OpenAI's app, Jonathan Raa, says the company needs to reduce the number of free daily videos to make money.

articles.title: 'Unexpectedly, a deer briefly entered the family room': Living with Gemini Home
articles.author: Ars Technica
articles.summary: Gemini for Home is a product that uses artificial intelligence to help you with home management.    It's the latest example of the generative AI boom. It's being integrated into virtually every product and service and it's useful for many things.

articles.title: Cypriot businesses offered subsidised AI training
articles.author: Cyprus Mail
articles.summary: The Cyprus Chamber of Commerce and Industry (Keve) has announced that a subsidised training programme on the effective integration of Generative Artificial Intelligence into business processes will take place on Tuesday, December 2, 2025, at the Almyra Hotel in Paphos. The training aims to equip people with ChatGPT, Gemini and Claude.

For those immersed in the cryptocurrency world, understanding the foundational shifts in AI development is crucial.
